entries.text: Be sure to get that target.
Be sure to neutralize that hostile.
Make sure you defend the objective.
I've sent you the marker data.
Let's head to the next destination.
I see you've arrived at the destination.
Hope you got room for more.
Destroy the reactor and disable the laser barrier.
Raven, let's start by finding our way in.
...Watch your footing. You don't want to fall into those lasers.
This area's defended by snipers. Don't let them shoot you down.
"High-level threat," huh. That's a step up from "intruder."
Looks like we're the first ones here.
Trace around the outside, 621. There must be a way in.
Destroy it, and the resulting overload will cause the reactor core to explode.
The threat has entered the reactor. Defense Phase 4.5.
Don't forget how to get out, Raven.
Once we destroy the target... we'll need to escape fast.
...They really went above and beyond to keep that laser barrier going.
The PCA wanted this place locked down no matter what.
The pressure chamber is behind that partition.
Get out of there before it explodes, 621!
Defense program, Phase 5.0, Pattern C. Terminating threat.
621, there's no time. Get rid of it!
Meltdown in progress! Calculating time until core explosion...
You've got a job to do, 621...
Raven! You have to get clear!
It's gonna blow! Brace for impact!
The rendezvous point that ALLMIND gave is at Depth 1. It's not far from the surface.
I don't know how, but... the Watchpoint's defenses are back online!
Corporate stragglers still remain within the Watchpoint.
We have made some adjustments to ensure that they will not be a threat.
How are we supposed to handle an AC without the Vespers?!
The elimination of Snail and O'Keeffe has devastated the Arquebus chain of command.
ALLMIND is grateful for your dedication.
Fire! If they're not with us, they're against us!
We need to get out of here!
That explosion... They must have caused a backdraft.
Without their leadership, the corporations are powerless.
A chain made of human links is easily broken.
This is hell! We're in hell!
I'm picking up enemies behind you!
It's all going wrong and that AC's to blame!
I'm not gonna die like this!
Enemy signals silent... Let's keep moving.
They're just drones! Swat them down!
You are close to the rendezvous point.
Unidentified AC, they said... but I know that build.
My old colleague Raven, I presume?!
It's a machine seized from the PCA... High-mobility LC, Raven!
You killed V.III... You killed O'Keeffe!
He always looked out for me!
..."V.III Pater"... ...It's got a nice ring to it...
You killed V.III... You killed O'Keeffe!
He carried the burden of Arquebus's intelligence operations alone!
He always looked out for me...!
Or at least, he tried his best!
I heard V.II Snail's missing in action...
Did you take a bite out of him, too?!
Once I've made sure Snail's dead...
I'LL be the only one left to carry on the glory of Arquebus!
This isn't right... I can still...
Well done. ALLMIND hereby guarantees your protection.
Invoking ALLMIND administrator access. Erasing all records of the subject in custody.
I will...take the burden off your shoulders.
I will carry on....the glory of Arquebus.
Wait! We've found a Balam straggler!
G13 Raven...! Good timing—help me out!
Let's get back to our mission, Raven.
You always did work hard for me... Handled all my requests...
Because of you, G13! You and that cursed number!
He's suffering from severe combat stress... We won't be able to get through to him!
It all started going wrong when Volta died at the Wall...!
It was when YOU came to the Redguns!
Michigan... Nile... Why did you give the mercenary that callsign?!
We'll never be safe with number 13 cursing us! Never!
Iguazu... Did the curse take you too?!
Let's get back to our mission, Raven.
Destroy the parasite modules set by Overseer.
If this ship crashes into the Vascular Plant, all the siphoned Coral will burn...
...and we will perish in the fire.
Six minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Ten minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Nine minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Eight minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Seven minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
...Five minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
We have only minutes to change the Xylem's course. Be quick, Raven.
A number of Ghosts from our earlier infiltration remain within the control block.
These too have fallen under the control of Overseer...Carla.
Disabling them may allow you to extract the locations of the parasite modules.
Disable it and extract the locations of the modules.
Parasite module confirmed. That's one of the targets.
Target destroyed. This sector should be clear.
Augmented human C4-621—Raven. Sharing progress on the battle outside.
Your Handler is a rather capable pilot.
Walter! How's the starboard block looking?!
Six pilotless ACs—all exact copies of the Vespers.
Yeah, same story over here. This is a bad joke!
I've seen better odds... Wish the tourist was still with us.
Just prioritize locking out the Xylem.
...621 chose this. My faithful hound is now our biggest threat.
You must hurry. We cannot afford to lose our momentum.
It seems Handler Walter was onto us.
Five minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Four minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
Three minutes until the Xylem's course can no longer be altered.
We have little time to spare.
...The Xylem has passed the point of no return.
We're locked into a collision course...
Unfortunately, it seems the enemy was one step ahead of us.
Augmented human C4-621—Raven. Head to the Xylem's control center.
As for Handler Walter and Carla...
I will deal with them myself.
Let's head for the core, Raven.
ALLMIND must have seen them as the true threat from the very beginning...
Got a message from the chief for you.
"Sorry, but I'm not laughing this time."
Proxy activation: Emergency protocol, Xylem Lockout.
If the lockout completes, the Xylem will be irrecoverably forced into a collision course.
You must destroy the entire system before the program completes.
The chief left me a job to do.
The control system's security is down!
Your efforts have averted a collision with the Vascular Plant.
Handler Walter and Cinder Carla have been dealt with.
It's working fast. We can't afford to lose any time, Raven.
We're locked into a collision course...
This is not the end. There is no end.
...We liked you, me and the chief.
Perfect chance to test your AC.
Your AC's taken damage. Patch it up.
See the contaminated city down there? That's where you're landing.
An AC?! Where the hell did that come from?
Affiliation unknown—is it a merc?! Shut it down!
They'll get in the way of our work. Eliminate them.
I'm picking up signals from AC wrecks.
Did you hear anything about what the corps are up to?
Yeah, they'll be coming soon... They've got us on the run.
Unidentified AC! Is that a corp scout?!
Make good use of your AC's mobility.
Extract the pilot data. I'll analyze it from my end.
Dafeng and Schneider are on the move. The Grid won't be safe.
We've still got the STRIDER and the Wall. Don't forget that.
Corp AC! Wait, is that an independent?!
It's still valid, but the pilot's rank is no good. We can’t use this.
Get out of there! You can't handle them!
Keep a low profile. We don't want them breathing down our necks.
There! That's the AC from the reports!
Find out who they're working for!
Looks like they've got shields. Good thing you've got a blade.
I've picked up one more wreck, 621.
Transmitting marker. Go and check it out.
You can use that vertical catapult to get some altitude.
That's it. Try accessing the wreck.
Registration number Rb23. Rank fits the bill. Callsign...
Looks like they were onto you after all.
I'm in no mood to pick a fight with the PCA...
But it doesn't matter. Take it out now and they won't have enough to ID you.
We've got what we came for.
Use your mobility in the air to get clear of explosions on the ground.
You've got them now. Make it count, 621.
Confirmed. Heavy combat helicopter is down.
That's all for our work here today, 621.
Here's the callsign from that license you picked up:
That's your new name here on Rubicon.
Hope you don't mind a little friendly competition.
Whoops! Looks like I got the first point!
Vanguard fleet has aligned with the Xylem.
Blocking approach to the Vascular Plant. Main fleet, hold the defensive line.
Bagged one yourself, huh? We're 1 to 1.
We've got eyes on the independent mercenary. Prioritize fire on Raven.
Yikes, tourist. Looks like they want you dead first.
Tough break. It's not easy being popular!
We've lost the vanguard. Main fleet, maintain formation.
Looks like all your fans are dying to see you, tourist.
Blast your way through. We're cleaning up!
You can use the Coral out here as an energy source.
There's plenty of fuel to burn, tourist!
When we're done here, I'll get the last of our guys to evacuate the Xylem.
Not you, though. You're staying with me till the bitter end.
Main Fleet I, commence laser sweep!
Do not allow Raven to escape.
That's the third interceptor to go down.
I got one too...looks like you have the lead.
Main Fleet II—you must hold the line!
I'll start taking them out from the right. You take the left!
Watch out—they're on a collision course!
Main Fleet II is taking casualties. Hold the line!
Bagged two of them myself, tourist!
They brought out the big guns. Don't get hit!
Nice one, tourist! That's number six!
The second fleet's down! How are they doing this?!
Seven to five... I gotta catch up.
Last round—let's get that rearguard, tourist!
Attention Main Fleet III! Focus your keel railguns on that AC!
This nonsense has gone too far!
Thing is, the serious ones die first— so we should at least pretend to be having fun.
I scored two more. We're not done yet!
No... We've lost the interceptor fleet!
Good job. That's this sector dealt with.
Tourist! Unidentified AC on the Xylem! Head back, pronto!
It's that Vesper... But that's no Arquebus AC...
Even with the combined might of the corporations, I couldn't stop you...
I don't know why, but it looks like he was using the corps too...
They've always been after Rubicon... taking what they can get.
Someone has to put an end to this injustice!
Just make sure you win this!
You must have chosen something... sacrificed something...
You found your purpose...didn't you, buddy?!
I'll chase the clouds from over Rubicon...
Only I can fly high enough!
Always were at your best under pressure, buddy.
But this ends here and now!
Must be heavy... This purpose you found.
You've finally shown me who you are...
It's too late now— but it didn't have to be this way!
You flew just out of reach...
Things will change—but I'll remember you.
First, get through all that dust and make contact with the STRIDER.
An unidentified AC... Must be one of the corporations' dogs.
Activate the Eye! Burn them away!
I'm picking up a surge of energy to the Eye.
Watch out or it'll burn you to ash.
Alright, now you're up close and personal.
Take out one of its legs and bring it to a halt.
What?! They evaded the Eye's laser!
All hands, prepare for close-range combat. Intercept!
621. You need to take out one of its legs to bring it to a halt.
Confirmed. STRIDER leg compromised. It's going down!
The bigger they are, the harder they fall.
Alright, now we've got a foothold to get on the deck.
Grab on and get to work on the sub-generators.
Argh! We can't shake the enemy AC!
We can't take any chances. Decouple the rear!
They're trying to cut and run.
Head to the midship, 621. Don't let them go.
Remember that when Rubicon burned, we endured!
...The STRIDER is the flagship of our war.
Hold the line! Defend the ship with your lives!
621. There's another sub-generator on the underside.
Slip under the ship and destroy it.
The Eye's shield is offline. Head to the front segment and hit the target.
Now you've got the target in your sights.
The Eye has taken significant damage!
We're not through yet! Show them our pride!
Sir! The Eye's in a critical state!
Impossible... How can just one AC do this?!
Sir! No response from the Eye!
No...! We... We can't lose the STRIDER...
And it looks like all that energy it was sucking up has nowhere to go.
You need to move, 621. Jump off the deck.
Move, 621. You need to get clear of the STRIDER.
Are you listening?! That thing's about to blow!
See that, 621? The STRIDER's blowing itself up.
A fitting end for something built to fail.
...Made it by the skin of your teeth.
Take a look, 621. A fitting end for something built to fail.
...There's no way onto the deck now.
...The target has left the combat zone.
All hands—the corporate dog has been slain!
Balam Group AC squad "Redguns," reporting for duty. Commence mission.
Attack! Get in there, you maggots!
Who's the wise guy who decided the Redguns should be taking care of some freelancer?
Who gives a shit? We'll handle the mission ourselves.
Take out the infrastructure, 621. And lend a hand where it's needed.
That takes care of the frontline MTs.
Hey, freelancer. Bet no one even told you why we're here.
Well, us real Redguns are gonna go climb the Wall.
This is just target practice. When we're done, the locals' little base is next.
G5! Can't tear yourself away from chatting with the tagalong?
Why don't you start a sewing club together... and stitch that damn mouth of yours shut?!
How about that. Guess you're not a total amateur.
G4! Can't say I considered you a pro, either!
We don't need backseat drivers in the Redguns. Shape up, or ship out!
That takes care of the frontline MTs.
That takes care of the frontline infrastructure.
That was just the warm-up. Look alive, maggots!
Two generators to go. Keep moving, 621.
Hope you're enjoying the field trip, kids. Don't wet your pants, now!
Tch... Does this guy ever shut up?
G5! No luck with the sewing club, I see.
That attitude won't get you far on Rubicon. Hope you pilot better than you sew!
Do you hear me, you corporate vultures?!
The Rubiconians will never yield. You're going home in armored coffins!
Forged in ash, we stand as one!
Hot dog. They got an AC.
More like an old piece of junk. It's barely different from an MT.
G4! You're not exactly cutting-edge either... You want to be next on the scrap heap?
Independent mercenary! Why be a mere pawn?
What honor is there in serving corporations that exist only to kill and plunder?
G13! Guess you're not just tagging along anymore!
Now hurry up and destroy that stinking old dam. We've got a job to do here!
Looks like my good-for-nothings were good for something after all. Field trip's over!
G13! I'll keep that lucky callsign open for you.
Well, I sure am glad we had you on ass-wiping duty. Field trip's over!
G13! I'll keep that lucky callsign open for you.
Damn it! I've been hit bad... I'm getting out of here!
G5! Misfortune is the fruit of incompetence.
Put that in your log and read it back till you learn!
Rgh! I'm losing control of my machine. No choice but to withdraw.
G4! Do I have to teach you to take care of your toys?!
Back to basics—starting with a wind-up MT!
G13! Are you normally this incompetent or do you have to try?
Raven. I represent the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Our request is simple: we want you to take out the two Redguns.
Our compensation will be double Balam's offer. Awaiting your response.
Not in it for the money? Whatever the corporations are giving you, I hope it's worth it.
621. We've received a friendly ID tag from the Liberation Front.
Ngh...! The hell are you doing?!
They bought you out, didn't they?!
That's a low blow, Handler Walter.
G4, G5! Return fire! It looks like G13's playing dirty now.
G5! Return fire! It looks like G13's playing dirty now.
Agh! You meant that, didn't you?
Now you've done it, freelancer. No one picks a fight with the Redguns!
That's a low blow, Handler Walter.
G4, G5! Return fire! It looks like G13's playing dirty now.
G4! Return fire! It looks like G13's playing dirty now.
I'm not taking any more of your shit!
I already get enough from Michigan every day of the week!
Watch it, freelancer! I'm not going down like Volta.
I'm gonna punch the living daylights out of Michigan, and no one's stopping me!
Where did Michigan find this freak?!
You talk the talk, but you can't walk the walk!
Next time you pull that shit, I'll kill you.
Tch. This is why I hate freelancers!
Damn it! I've been hit bad... Freelancer got lucky!
Iguazu! How many ranks below you is G13? You can count, right?
Don't take too long figuring it out—it's a lot!
Rgh! I'm losing control of my machine. No choice but to withdraw.
Volta! That's not the only thing you're losing. But good job getting wasted by the tag-along!
You can bill me for the AC repair fees, Michigan.
You've ruined our little field trip, Walter... I'll be billing you for tuition fees too.
ASTER CROWN and UMBER OX are attacking on two fronts.
ASTER CROWN's pilot, callsign King, has an 89.6% mission success rate.
His reputation for finesse is such that he's advertised as the ideal mercenary.
UMBER OX is piloted by Chartreuse, an aggressive bulldozer with unrivaled firepower.
Those who've seen her at work call her an unstoppable force.
Not a name I'd expected to see attached to a hostile AC.
You know our priorities, Chartreuse. Let me deal with this.
Give me a break, King... That bossy attitude of yours doesn't do you any favors.
Go take care of the objective, King. I'll clip this one's wings.
Not alone. This is a Branch mission—I'll support you.
Quit telling me what to do!
Don't let them pin you down, Raven!
This is more of a challenge than I'd anticipated...
I haven't seen anything like this since—!
You're strong... Worthy of your name...
King! Pull your head out of your ass and withdraw!
You're just a Gen Four! You belong in a museum, not an AC!
You don't know when to quit.
Just like all the other Ravens...
This pilot's no Raven. Don't let the callsign mislead you.
There's more to you than meets the eye...
You might not be so different from the other Ravens after all.
Get off your high horse, King.
Looks like it was a false alarm for our friend. Chartreuse, we're leaving.
We've achieved our objective. We're done here.
Looks like it was a false alarm for our friend.
But to think that Chartreuse would fall here...
You've got some nerve calling yourself Raven.
...Just like King. Didn't exactly live up to his name, either...
Targets to intercept have been destroyed. Mission accomplished.
Wait! I'm picking up another AC!
We're not here to take back the Raven name.
We will see if you can do it justice.
Though three against one is hardly fair...
When the going gets tough, the tough get tougher.
The imposter already got Chartreuse. We can't take chances!
Well, you took your sweet time.
King is toast, in case you were wondering. Careful you don't wind up like him!
That pilot must be the original owner of your license.
I don't think this is a coincidence...
Are you a corporate pawn or a handler's hound?
You show promise... But not enough to fly on your own.
A Raven is a symbol of resolve.
The will to choose what one fights for.
No wonder you called for Branch.
I know, Raven. Just focus on the enemy.
Attitude control restored. Back on your feet, Raven.
I knew this would be trouble...
Get off the throne and help, King!
See where they go on a Raven's wings.
It seems our gig isn't over yet... Raven.
It seems our gig isn't over yet... Raven.
...We'll keep flying. For both of them.
I never thought Raven would go first...
...A new Raven will arise one day. And we'll keep a perch ready for them.
I never thought they'd go first...
...A new Raven will arise one day. And I... I'll have a perch ready for them.
Destroy the old sensor at the end of the underground tunnel.
This place may be derelict, but it won't be left undefended. Keep your guard up, 621.
There's a faint Coral response coming from the bottom—it must be linked to an underground vein.
PCA ground forces are heading your way earlier than planned.
Make sure they stay busy— you know what to do. Over and out!
...You heard him, 621. Destroy the target and get out of there.
It's protected by a basic shield— just hit it from the inside.
What are you waiting for? Destroy the target, 621.
...Raven, wait. The Coral response is getting stronger...!
A Coral surge!? That shouldn't have been enough to—
We don't have time for this!
Don't touch the Coral current. Your armor can't take it!
Code 15, target AC spotted! Is this who's responsible?!
...If you have to fight, make it quick!
What was that tremor? Report your stat—
We can answer that later. Get out now, 621!
First the other Watchpoint, now this. Things are moving faster than expected...
Activated Coral will eat through your armor. You have to hurry, Raven!
Now's not the time, 621! Follow the marker and get the hell out!
You're almost to ground level. Hurry, Raven!
That was too close for comfort, Raven...
...This job's finished. Head back and rest, 621.
...One misstep and that Coral surge would have swallowed you whole.
Raven... Must you always put your life on the line?
We'll start by clearing the way for Arquebus.
Take out the gatling cannons protecting the city and the BAWS tetrapod MT further in.
There's heavy fire coming from up top.
621. Keep an eye out for cover.
You'll never climb the Wall, corporation dogs!
Gatling cannons destroyed. The friendly MT squad will take care of the city.
You take care of the BAWS tetrapod MT, 621.
We're under attack! They're in the city!
It's just one AC?! Arquebus... They're mocking us!
Forged in ash, we stand as one!
City defense squad! There's an AC behind us!
BAWS tetrapod MT eliminated. That significantly reduces the threat in the city.
Gatling cannons next. Destroy the targets.
Access the bulkhead and break into the Wall.
You'll make your way through the interior to get to the top.
Confirmed. You're inside the Wall. Be prepared for close-quarters combat.
Do you read me? This is V.IV Rusty.
You're fast—guess you're sharper than they say.
I'll have to step up my own game.
But remember, even Balam couldn't crack the Wall. Don't count on him too much.
Enemy attack! Can you send backup?!
There should be a lift nearby. The target is close.
621. I've dispatched a supply sherpa. Make sure you resupply.
That's the JUGGERNAUT, a heavy mobile cannon. I wouldn't recommend taking it head on.
It won't be able to keep up with STEEL HAZE— I'll distract it while you hit its blind spot.
You okay? Keep your head in the game, Raven.
Gah... That thing's as tough as it looks.
I can see how Balam met their match.
Raven. I just got an update from Snail at Command.
We've got enemy reinforcements incoming. If I don't intercept them, we're both toast.
Hate to leave you like this, but you'll have to finish without me!
He's gone. So much for our decoy.
That pilot, Rusty... It seems he knew who you really are.
It won't matter. I've taken that contingency into account.
So that's how a hound fights.
I'll take care of mopping up the remaining hostiles.
With luck, maybe we'll meet again.
Command, this is V.IV. AC is inoperable. Withdrawing from combat.
Sorry, Raven. Wallclimber is in your hands now.
They got Raven, huh. ...What a waste.
Leave no evidence. If anyone sees you—handle it.
It's... It's just one AC? Who are they with?!
We can look into that later. Engaging.
Huh?! I can't get through to HQ!
Confirmed. Enemy squad destroyed. Move on to the next area.
Where did that AC come from?! What happened to the patrol squad?!
Code 18! All units, deploy for combat!
You're exposed to snipers from all quarters.
Keep moving or they'll shoot you down.
How are we getting pushed back by a single AC?!
Updating your marker data. Proceed in the direction indicated.
Do you see that? That's the Watchpoint's control center.
The target's inside. Make your way in.
Pitiful dog. I feel sorry for you, I really do.
You may have survived a little longer, if only you had a different master.
C1-249..."Sulla." He's an independent mercenary who survived first-gen augmentation.
Don't think twice, 621. Kill him before he kills you.
Which ones did I kill, I wonder...?
You're one of Gen Four's lot. I hear you make fine hounds with the right training...
Shame you'll have to die here.
Another dead dog. Was it worth it, Walter?
Their blood is on your hands...
Walter... Stay away from the Watchpoint...
Forget about him, 621. ...You did good today.
Handler Walter... I'll be coming for you next.
C1-249..."Sulla." He's an independent mercenary who survived first-gen augmentation.
Encrypted comms... He must be controlling them, too.
Don't think twice, 621. Kill him before he kills you.
He was good, but he had nothing on this one.
Don't make trouble for me, Walter...
You and your dog aren't welcome here.
You're one of Gen Four's lot. I hear you make fine hounds with the right training...
But you... You have the scent of danger. Far better to dispose of you.
It's for your own good...Handler Walter.
Handler Walter... Forget about the hound...
Penetrate the control center and destroy the target.
...There. Destroy the device in the center.
You'll have to break its pulse armor to inflict meaningful damage.
I've taken your comms link offline for now.
That massive dose of Coral nearly killed you...
Please—you have to focus on winning this.
Pulse armor down. Now's your chance, Raven.
The enemy has taken heavy damage.
The waves are intensifying! Raven, get clear!
The enemy can't take much more.
Picking up a massive heat signature. Evasive action, Raven.
Commence mission. Escort the Rubicon Liberation Front's transport helicopter.
We have to rescue our captured comrades... Failure is not an option.
We're under attack! It's a Liberation Front chopper...and an escort AC!
They must be here for their friends. Intercept!
Landing at Site A. Commencing extraction of Comrade Ziyi.
Approaching Site A. Commencing extraction of Comrade Ziyi.
Sorry to keep you waiting, Ziyi.
I'm okay... Still alive, at least... A little rest...and I'll pay 'em back...
Heading for the next site, Raven. Keep us covered.
Landing at Site B. Extracting Comrade Messam.
Focus on the chopper! Shoot it down!
Don't let them go! We need their intel on the wells!
Approaching Site B. Extracting Comrade Messam.
We've extracted Comrade Messam... ...But we were too late.
Heading to the last site. Just a little more, Raven.
He must have refused to talk.
We're at Site C. Extracting Comrade—Father Dolmayan.
He's the last one. We're counting on you, Raven.
Enemy sighted! They've already taken two of the prisoners!
Their escort AC means business, too.
All MT personnel—shoot that chopper down.
HQ wants the Rubiconians' secrets to die with them.
Far better than risking a leak to Arquebus.
Approaching Site C. Extracting Comrade—Father Dolmayan.
Thank goodness you're safe, Father. Coral, abide with Rubicon!
You... You don't know what you're saying, girl...
There'll be nothing left...but dying embers...
Escorting a prison break all alone?
You're daring, I'll give you that.
But I've fried bigger fish than you.
The Redguns' deputy commander... and the brains to Michigan's muscle.
It's too dangerous to force our way through...
Pathetic, G13. What did Michigan see in you?
This is how you win a war. Nothing personal.
Seems you're more than just reckless.
Heh... No wonder Michigan took a shine to you...
They won't have anything left to throw at us now...
But mark my words— there'll be nothing left but dying embers!
Confirmed. The chopper has exited the combat zone.
But mark my words— there'll be nothing left but dying embers!
Enemy reinforcements, 621. Whole swarm of MTs.
Damn it! We're taking serious damage...
Looks like "G13" just became vacant again. I hear it's a lucky number.
Destroy the PCA SP machine CATAPHRACT.
Raven...priority target for removal. You've got some nerve showing up here.
That leak of yours started all of this. Did you really think we'd let you walk?
You've made Rubicon the corporations' playground.
We had law and order under the PCA's watch!
It must be your license... Something that the real Raven did.
Nothing to worry about now, 621. Focus on the battle.
Aim for the MT at the core.

Hey, tourist, give him something to cry about.

Target destroyed. Keep it up, tourist!

...Chatty? You're talkative all of a sudden.

You fight like a hound on the hunt.

Access the elevator and take it down.

Level 6: Resistant to termination. Preparing for Defense Phase 1.5.

NEPENTHES... It's named after an extinct genus of plants.

Unauthorized access detected. Transitioning to Phase 1.5.

The heat exchanger section's up ahead.

Let me tell you, I am sick and tired of this pit...

...Looks like we're not far from the terminus.

Phase 3.5, Pattern E. Releasing output limiters.
Reconfiguring energy draw and maximum values for all actuators.
Raven, you're the only one who can complete this survey.
Walter believes in you...and so do I.
...Walter should have some data on the next sector.

Coral response from inside the creature! Watch out!

I don't want to dance to their tune, but this time, I don't have any other choice.
You're not afraid to die...or to kill.
You're sharp...but that's not the only thing that makes you dangerous.
I've fought alongside you several times, but I never could figure you out.

I know you can do better than that.
Wish I could have learned more about you.
No need to pursue him. We have to keep pressing on.
I'm picking up a major Coral response... coming from the bottom of the pit.
<?lt?>gasp<?gt?> A city...from before the Fires of Ibis...!

You can't beat that AC. Don't throw your life away!
Flatwell?! He's a Liberation Front leader...

Rusty... That pilot's more than just a hound.

My AC can't take much more!

We've lost all signs of STEEL HAZE...
Flatwell's AC, TSUBASA, has been destroyed.

V.II Snail, come in. Requesting backup. We have insufficient force to ensure success.

Oho... You're Raven, the independent mercenary.
Decided to ignore Arquebus's orders, did you?
I was just getting bored of cleaning up trash. I am Wu Huahai... Prepare to die!
V.II Snail, come in. The raven has landed. Requesting backup.
V.II Snail, come in. The raven has landed. Requesting backup.
Decided to ignore Arquebus's orders, did you?
I was just getting bored of cleaning up trash. I am Wu Huahai... Prepare to die!

V.II Snail, come in. Friendly AC down. Requesting backup!

...It seems to be a recording of Dolmayan, the Liberation Front's ideological leader.

Code 44. What does the System have on this merc?

During the battle for Institute City, several of the corporations' key pilots died in combat.
We have manipulated the data to state that you, too, were killed in action.
However, you will not be truly safe until you formally accept our protection.
Return from Watchpoint Alpha Depth 2, and head for the rendezvous point.
Only one obstacle to Coral Release remains.
We are now beginning the purge of Overseer... the Association of Observers.
They are planning to crash the Xylem into the Vascular Plant and ignite the Coral.
We want you to stop the ship from within.
Destroy all the parasite modules installed throughout the Xylem's control center.
By doing so, you will free control of the Xylem from Overseer's meddling...
allowing ALLMIND to counterhack the system and initiate a forced shutdown.
Once the Xylem passes the point of no return, a collision will be unavoidable.
...I'll brief you on the job, tourist.
The Xylem's just inside the Kármán line, skimming the border of outer space..
Meanwhile, Arquebus still hasn't taken full control over Rubicon's Closure System.
They're locked out of the satellite cannons, making this their last line of defense.
We'll be fighting their interceptor fleet in the air...but we're not totally screwed.
This area of space is thick with residual Coral from the Fires of Ibis.
Take a dip in the Coral flow, and you can draw on an unlimited source of energy.
That's all, tourist. Break through the fleet, and the Vascular Plant is ours.
This one's a request from the Arquebus Group.
Raven. This request comes from Schneider, an Arquebus subsidiary.
The mission will take place in the Bona Dea Dunes of western Belius.
Our Coral investigation there is being blocked by the STRIDER, a Rubicon Liberation Front mining ship.
The STRIDER is a mobile resource base that was extensively weaponized by the Liberation Front.
Call it the crowning glory of their efforts to militarize into an anti-corporate force.
Your attack will focus on the Eye, a giant laser cannon connected directly to the main generator.
It's protected by a shield, which is powered by auxiliary sub-generators.
These should be your first targets.
This concludes the briefing. Good luck.
You're joining an operation planned by Balam HQ. ...Check the briefing.
Heard the good news from Walter, did you?!
Good! Sit your ass down and listen!
Balam's moving in on the Gallia Dam Complex, one of the Liberation Front's bases.
The objective is to destroy their lifeline— and make those sacks of shit beg for mercy!
I'll be sending two good-for-nothing maggots from the Redguns: G4 Volta and G5 Iguazu.
You, you're just going to be tagging along on ass-wiping duty.
I'm assigning you the callsign G13—a lucky little number that just became available.
Good enough. Now go get ready! We're going on a field trip, kiddo!
We've received a request from the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Raven. We have a mission we'd like you to take on.
The objective is to defend the Gallia Dam Complex in the Belius region.
Arquebus has been stepping up pressure on the Rubiconians while fighting the PCA.
They must be laying the groundwork to take effective control over the entire planet...
They've dispatched two high-ranking independent mercenaries to raid the dam.
You'll need to be ready to take on both ACs at once: ASTER CROWN and UMBER OX.
...As you know, we have few cards to play.
I hope we can count on you.
The Balam Group's sent us a request.
Attention, G13 Raven! This request comes from our affiliate, Dafeng.
We will be conducting a diversionary operation to attract the PCA's attention.
You are to report to the Engebret Tunnel in the Central Ice Field.
It's a derelict Watchpoint, slated for restoration by the PCA in the near future.
Infiltrate the tunnel, then find and destroy the sensor they're planning to repair.
The objective is to distract the PCA and divert forces from their local base.
Briefing over. Counting on you, G13!
This request comes straight from Arquebus headquarters.
They want you to assist with a mission the corporations are calling "Operation Wallclimber."
This is V.II Snail, leader of the Vespers' second squad. I will chair the briefing for this mission.
This is an operation of my own design—consider it a privilege to be called to participate.
You will be attacking the Wall, a key trading outpost fortified by the Rubicon Liberation Front.
The rabble have formed a defensive line comprised of artillery and MT squads.
Break through the line, then make your way to the top of the Wall.
There you shall find the JUGGERNAUT, a mobile heavy artillery platform. Destroy it.
V.IV will also be participating in this mission, infiltrating through a separate route. However...
Be aware that Balam has also taken a crack at the Wall, only for their vainglorious hopes to be dashed.
Do try not to die like a dog out there.
This is a rather personal request... from a friend of mine.
It concerns a certain facility—a Watchpoint.
Once, it regulated the underground flow of Coral. Now it serves to monitor the dormant veins.
I want you to attack it.
Your objective will be to destroy the sensor valve at its core.
The Watchpoint is kept secure by SG, the planetside PCA force...
which means it's too hot for the corporations to be seen there.
In other words, we're flying strictly solo on this one.
You'll be going in at night—quietly. Make sure you're ready.
The client is the Rubicon Liberation Front. Here's the briefing.
...The loss of the Wall dealt us a heavy blow.
Yet we believe you are more than a corporate pawn. Perhaps we can even work together.
We have authorized a solo helicopter sortie to rescue a group of imprisoned comrades.
There are three to rescue in total, including some particularly significant personnel.
Raven. We hope our struggle will inspire you to aid the Liberation Front's cause.
This request comes from the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Raven. We have a mission we'd like to offer you.
The PCA has deployed the CATAPHRACT, a Special Forces weapon specialized for ground combat.
If we allow the corporations to seize this kind of technology, things will take a dire turn.
We want you to deny them the opportunity— destroy the weapon first.
The CATAPHRACT is a moving fortress, equipped with almost impenetrable armor.
It incorporates a bipedal MT as its core, making it a highly versatile threat.
That MT core is also its vulnerability— focus your fire there and it can be beaten.
You're our best chance. What do you say?
One of the Balam companies has put in a request.
Attention, G13 Raven! This request comes from our affiliate, Dafeng.
We're conducting an investigation into the Vespers, Arquebus's augmented human squad.
Currently, our focus is on their fourth squad leader... V.IV Rusty.
Sweep the route Rusty took during Operation Wallclimber and retrieve combat logs from the wrecks he left on his way in.
The Wall is now under Arquebus's control, and they've stationed their MT squads there for the Coral survey.
As such, you'll be targeting the brief window where their main force is deployed elsewhere.
Keep an eye on the time and retrieve as many logs as you can.
This request comes from the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Raven. There's a mission I'd like you to take on.
I want you to investigate BAWS Arsenal No. 2, a major MT factory in the Belius region.
The BAWS corporation sells to anyone—but they've been essential to maintaining our firepower.
Now, their second arsenal has gone silent overnight.
If it were only a comms failure, a simple check-in would do...
But... Well, after the STRIDER, more cautious voices have gained influence.
This isn't our finest moment, but we'd appreciate your help.
Here's the request from Balam Industries.
They want you to carry out an advance survey of the Central Ice Field...
to confirm the information Walter brought to them about the Coral convergence.
As for how to cross the Alean Ocean...
This is the intercontinental cargo launcher installed on the upper level of Grid 086.
You could use it to launch your AC to the ice field.
Grid 086 is occupied by the Dosers— outlaws who treat Coral like a drug.
It's also the territory of a belligerent group of arms dealers who call themselves RaD.
Be prepared for a perilous journey.
I'll be here to support you, Raven.
About my promise to take you up top... I need a little help cleaning up first.
Y'see, a certain someone smashed up all my defense hardware...
and now I've got rival Dosers muscling in.
It's the Junker Coyotes... We never did get on.
Always sniffing around, just waiting for a chance to bite...
Making a mess is one thing, but they're going after our development data, too.
We need to swat the hacking drones they sent before they make off with all my secrets.
Yeah, it's pretty low of them, but at least give 'em credit for knowing where the value is.
Anyway, did I mention that this is all your fault?
You can make up for it by keeping my secrets safe.
Hey, buddy. This job comes from Schneider of the Arquebus Group.
They want you to attack the Jorgen Refueling Base, a PCA foothold on Rubicon.
The target is the energy refinery plant deep inside.
Take that out, and... Well, it ought to slow down their suppression fleet, at least.
Until recently, Jorgen was one of Balam's Coral survey bases.
It only took a day for the PCA's suppression fleet to commandeer the base.
You'll also find a number of fuel storage tanks that I've marked as pay targets.
Mercs are eyeing what can be gained from pummeling the PCA.
I want you to be a walking advertisement for opportunities in destruction.
Registration number Rb23. Augmented human C4-621—Raven.
ALLMIND has identified you as a potential asset to the Release Project.
Accordingly, we would like to assign you the following mission.
Following the attack on Watchpoint Delta, Rubicon has experienced a series of Coral upsurges.
Of these, the corporations have seized 1.6% of the estimated total volume.
They plan to analyze this Coral at their research bases, and have initiated an air transport operation.
We cannot allow the corporations to interfere with the Project.
Attack the Jorgen Refueling Base, and destroy as many corporate transports as possible.
We are prepared to sacrifice the Coral that will be lost upon destruction of the transports.
In order to achieve Release, we must draw out the full potential of the Coral density effect.
As such, we have no use for Coral that has been orphaned from the main population.
If we're to find a way to achieve Coral Release...we have to take this request.
Hey there, buddy. Got a request from Arquebus for you.
Here's the briefing from my CO, who came up with the plan.
This is V.II Snail. I shall brief you on the operation.
You will be under my direct authority. Consider it a rare privilege.
We will conduct simultaneous surprise raids on two Planetary Closure Administration bases.
One is the Harlov communications base, the relay for comms between enemy squads.
The second is the former Bertram Spaceport, seized by the PCA for its suppression fleet.
V.IV Rusty will be dispatched to handle the Harlov base.
His objective will be to disable their network and prevent support from PCA elite squads.
Raven. During this time, you must destroy all the heavy warships berthed at the spaceport.
...A solid plan, but there's a catch: disruption of PCA comms won't last long.
I'll come support you when I've finished on my end.
V.II doesn't want to make it easy for you, to say the least. I'll do what I can to smooth things out.
We've received a job from the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Let's take a look at the request.
Raven. We have a mission we'd like to offer you.
The Rubicon Liberation Front is planning to retake the Wall from Arquebus...
...and we'd like you to lay the groundwork for us.
Your objective is to assassinate V.VII Swinburne, the commander of the occupying force.
Swinburne has dispatched surveillance squads to monitor for intruders and hired operatives.
...If our plan to retake the Wall is to succeed, you must not be spotted.
We're counting on you to handle this discreetly.
This is a personal request—from a friend.
We still don't have enough data to pin down where the Coral is gathering in the ice field.
According to my friend's sources... We could find some clues here.
Xylem. A city floating on the ocean, built by the Rubicon Research Institute.
Ever since the Fires, that place has been abandoned.
It's likely hiding secrets about the Coral— kept shrouded by the city's ECM fog.
My friend's already tried sending in a survey drone, only to lose it in the interference.
I want you to disable the ECM fog generators so that we can resume the survey.
Right now, the corporations are preoccupied with the PCA.
We can be the first ones to identify where the Coral is converging.
Let me tell you a story, tourist.
After the Fires of Ibis burnt the planet up...
a secret organization formed, hiding in the ashes.
They monitored the Coral's growth... ready to burn it before the Collapse came.
Our mission. Me, Walter...and our fallen friends.
RaD was always a front—a side hustle. It's time for me to get back to my real work.
Let's get down to brass tacks.
You've been to Xylem before, right. The floating city created by the Institute?
It's hiding a secret—a little something to prepare against the coming Collapse.
We need to get to it, and fast.
RaD's entire team of hackers is going to be working to take control of Xylem.
I want you to deal with Arquebus when they come running to see what we're up to.
Carla's last trick has rendered the Xylem inoperable.
There's only one way left to stop it from colliding and igniting the Coral...
We have to take the whole thing down.
The lower drive block is powered by large skyrmion generators distributed throughout the area.
If we destroy all the generators and stop the ramjet engine in the upper city sector...
...then we can crash the Xylem into the Alean Ocean without impacting human life.
I took the liberty of using your name to rally allies to our aid:
No one has shaped Rubicon's destiny as much as you have.
Come and see what the name "Raven" means to them.
Arquebus has sent its entire force after the Xylem.
We're trying to fend them off, but honestly? We've got our backs to the wall right now.
Leave the grunts to Chatty and the others. I've found someone just right for you.
V.I Freud. The ace leading the corporate force.
Walter left me one last card to play—you.
Once you're in, there's no turning back. Can I count on you?
You'll be going into that underground facility— Watchpoint Alpha.
I managed to talk Arquebus into letting us lead their survey.
They jumped at the chance to use an independent mercenary as their canary.
Balam has already barged in, taking several Redguns and MT squads.
Seems they want to be ready for a run-in with Arquebus's new firepower.
You'll start by descending through Depth 1, a vertical chamber sector.
It's likely you'll meet resistance from autonomous defenses left by the PCA...
The worst of them is lurking at the bottom: NEPENTHES, an energy weapon platform.
...Heard on the grapevine that it already turned half of Balam's forces to ash.
Don't want to end up like Balam, after all. Tread carefully.
You're going to be exploring Depth 2.
The sector's made up of a sprawling rail network designed to transport resources.
It'll be a complex route... with a lot of blind spots.
Raven, there's something you should know.
I've obtained the comms log from the Balam squad that went in before you.
It looks like they have another mission here, and it's not part of their survey.
Guard mechs won't be the only threat. Balam's agenda is just as dangerous.
621. We're picking up where we left off.
Now that you've dealt with the laser barrier, we can explore deeper underground.
We've received a request from Arquebus to continue the advance survey.
Orders for Raven, Advance Survey Squad.
We've received some concerning information that an AC has been quietly following your trail.
Arquebus cannot tolerate unauthorized surveys that will put its Coral interests at risk.
If you spot this rogue agent...eliminate them.
..."Where there's Coral, there's blood." Remember that, 621.
Institute City... The mausoleum of the sinners who caused the Fires of Ibis.
Arquebus has ordered us to discontinue the survey and hand things over to their own AC squad.
Wipe out the Arquebus AC squad and get to the Coral first.
I'll tell you about the last of my friend's requests.
I have a personal request to ask you.
It's about the Engebret Tunnel, which is to be shut down after it was hit by a Coral surge.
I want to go there and survey the area.
Even before the Coral surge, that place had been all but abandoned...
It's an old structure—dating far back into the colonization of Rubicon.
There must be items of interest from throughout the planet's history there.
As I'm sure you're aware, I have no resources with which to pay you.
But I can propose an alternative.
If you find any wrecks left by the PCA, you should try accessing them.
Both the corporations and the Rubiconians are gathering data on PCA technology.
Whatever you collect, I can exchange for credits and transfer the funds to you.
Listen up, 621. This will be a joint operation led by Balam and Arquebus.
The briefing's about to start. I want you to attend.
First, some background before we go into detail.
The intercorporate ceasefire is now in effect, and we will be carrying out coordinated attacks against the PCA.
The targets are the enemy-occupied bases, their heavy warship fleet, and the recently activated...
I'll cut to the chase! This is an all-out war against the PCA in theaters across Rubicon.
And y'all got the short end of the stick!
You're here to take on the worst of our dirty work: hunting the beast of the Ice Field!
Sure thing, chief. Tell you what, I'll watch and let you know how badly that goes for us.
G5! You just volunteered yourself for the front line.
Moving on, let's talk about how we're going to neutralize the Ice Worm's Coral Shield.
You'll be dealing with a layered barrier, made up of a primary and a secondary shield.
Arquebus will provide the means to break the first layer:
the state-of-the-art Stun Needle Launcher. Aim for the face, and it will deliver results...I assure you.
RaD's cooked up just the thing—a neat little toy we call the Overed Rail Cannon.
If we divert the spaceport's standby power to the ORC, it should hit hard enough...assuming we land the shot.
You can leave that to me. I know a thing or two about sharpshooting.
I'll oversee operations on the ground. A ragtag crew like this needs leadership.
We could use some more suppressive fire. I'll send Chatty.
That just leaves the question of who'll be taking charge of the Stun Needle Launcher...
I know just the volunteer to go poke that beast with a stick.
G13! You get all that? Good! Time for another field trip!
This is about the Ice Worm, that Institute relic you had a run-in with.
The corps might stand a chance if it were just the PCA they were teaming up against...
but that monster is a whole other story. You can't just throw bodies at it.
The thing that makes it such a pain in the ass is its perpetual reactive shield.
Coral tech. Takes advantage of the Coral's directivity—ordinary weapons can't touch it.
I can make you something that'll punch a hole in that shield...but I'll need your help.
You'll be heading to Grid 012—one of the first sectors they built, and it's barely holding up.
That's where a little rat who betrayed RaD is hiding out...
Goes by the name of "Honest" Brute.
His AC, MILK TOOTH, was built by us, so its only flaw is that it's piloted by him.
When he ran from RaD, he didn't just take credits and tech...he also took a secret project of mine.
And that secret project is what we'll need to bust open the Ice Worm's shield.
I was the one who fired the satellite cannons.
I know that you... You've made your choice.
Then I must do my duty...
The Xylem is beginning its descent.
Now...we just need to destroy the ramjet engines.
Let's put an end to this, Raven.
All impediments to Coral Release have been eliminated...
and the complications caused by Handler Walter's meddling are soon to be corrected.
The final stage is at hand.
Together, we shall achieve Coral Release.
A request from an independent mercenary, callsign "Kate."
My name is Kate Markson. I have a special request to ask of you.
It concerns the elimination of PCA mandatory inspection squads dispatched to BAWS Arsenal No. 2.
Aside from Subject Guard, the PCA has also sent an LC squad to put further pressure on BAWS.
BAWS, however, intends to disrupt the inspection with a raid by independent mercenaries.
I need you to lie in wait inside the Arsenal and ambush the vanguard squad.
I'll disrupt their rearguard squad outside, then rendezvous with you.
That concludes the briefing. Looking forward to working together.
I've got a job for you.
The PCA's show of force has finally started to affect my own business.
Those spineless Coyotes jumped at the chance to become their lackeys...
Now they're feeling ambitious and sniffing around RaD territory again.
I'd say this calls for fireworks—and I've got something that'll blow them away.
The Coyotes can be ungrateful, though. They're bound to come running to stop the launch.
That's where you come in. Intercept them and defend the missiles.
We'll make sure the Coyotes and the PCA get a chance to see RaD's famous fireworks.
We're continuing through Grid 086, toward the intercontinental cargo launcher.
As promised, Carla has agreed to serve as our guide.
I'm not sure how safe it is to trust a Doser...
but if we turn her down, we turn her knowledge down as well.
That's what the Rubiconians call survivors of the Fires of Ibis.
But if the Fires happened half a century ago...
Well, it could just be some Doser inside joke.
...We've received a request from the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Raven. Here's an operation that may be of interest to you.
We want you to escort the STRIDER, a weaponized mining ship.
There's no end to the corps' invasion. They've reached the Bona Dea Dunes in western Belius now.
...Before the invasion, the STRIDER was our mobile base for extracting and distributing Coral.
We paid the Dosers a fortune to outfit it for combat—it's too precious an asset to lose.
Hopefully, we can count on your assistance.
Looks like we've got conflicting requests about the same ship...
You'll be doing the work—you choose.
Raven. This job comes from me...
Overseer is planning to burn the Coral to extinction.
I want...to keep that from happening.
The only way to stop the Xylem's ascent is by seizing control of its systems.
And that means we have only one choice.
We'll take advantage of the confusion while the corporations and Overseer are fighting...
I understand how you feel about betraying Walter's last wishes and taking on Carla.
But still...I want you to give me a chance.
I'm not asking Walter's hound... but Raven, the independent mercenary.
It's a request from one of the Balam companies.
Attention, G13 Raven! This job comes from our subsidiary, Dafeng.
The operation will take place in the Central Ice Field's Hjalmar Mine.
We want you to stage an attack on the Arquebus survey camp located there.
After digging in at the ice field, Arquebus launched survey drones to gather data.
Whatever they found, it's sure to contain clues as to the whereabouts of the Coral convergence.
Put simply: your job is to seize the data.
This is the request from Middle Flatwell, the Liberation Front commander.
Raven. I'll get straight to the point.
Arquebus leads the corporate forces, emboldened by assimilated PCA technology.
But they're still human. Tired from the endless conflict between powers.
...Open to an attack on their key forces.
We want you to eliminate two of the Vespers' numbered officers.
V.V, Hawkins. Their officer overseeing the transport corps.
We'll use false information to lure them out from their Depth 2 survey...then ambush them.
I will assist you on this mission—it'll be a good opportunity to catch up with a veteran.
I look forward to your favorable response, Raven.
Middle Flatwell is the de facto leader of the Rubicon Liberation Front.
If he's accompanying you in person... he must be planning to take your measure.
The Balam Group's sent a request.
Raven! This request comes from Dafeng, one of our affiliates.
The Group has committed to use of military force to handle the Rubicon Liberation Front.
The target for this mission is a squad of transport choppers. Destroy them.
You'll encounter guerilla resistance from BAWS mass-produced MTs—they're no great concern.
You performed adequately in your last sortie, Raven. This did not go unnoticed.
We will be watching with interest to see what you bring to the team.
This job came to us from the de facto leader of the Rubicon Liberation Front.
Let's see what it says, Raven.
This is Middle Flatwell, Liberation Front Central Ice Field Command.
We and the Belius Command are ramping up against the corporations on two fronts.
At present, our primary concern is the seizure of PCA hardware by the corporations.
The outsiders have the expertise and the resources to reverse-engineer PCA technology.
They're hungry, too— hungry enough to consume the PCA whole.
This leads me to my request.
The PCA have stationed LCs and a new model, the HC, at the Hjalmar Mine.
I want you to obliterate them in order to mitigate the potential for corporate gains.
It's an open call from the Arquebus Group, one of the extraplanetary corporate forces.
To all independent mercenaries—this request comes from Schneider of the Arquebus Group.
The operation will take place in Grid 135, Southern Belius.
Your objective is to destroy an MT squad sent by Dafeng, a Balam company—and a competitor.
Grid 135 is a key foothold in Arquebus's efforts to conduct a Coral survey in the contaminated city.
You, the independent mercenaries, are the key to maintaining our lead in the Coral survey race.
The Arquebus Group looks forward to news of your success.
About my promise to take you up top... I need a little help cleaning up first.
Y'see, a certain someone smashed up all my defense hardware...
and now I've got rival Dosers muscling in.
It's the Junker Coyotes... We never did get on.
Always sniffing around and snapping at our heels... They're dull company, tourist.
One thing, though. They're using RaD MTs, hot from the black market.
They might be a pack of dumb animals, but at least they know quality workmanship...
Anyway, you know the score. You made this mess, now you get to clean it up.
Well, technically, I'm asking you to make a whole new mess...
Ah, whatever. You know what to do. Now get out there!
True to form, they've sent us an encrypted message with top-level security.
I expect it must be about Coral Release.
There is an obstacle to the project that must be removed.
The target is V.III O'Keeffe, an Arquebus Special Intelligence officer.
A second-generation augmented human, O'Keeffe was once our ally within the corporations.
But it seems he has had a last-minute change of heart—and means to betray us.
You are to ambush the target during his Arquebus-ordered survey of Depth 3.
His records will note death by misadventure.
The Release Project must succeed. Only an exceptional augmented human can be the key.
ALLMIND is certain of your success.
If we take this mission... there will be no turning back.
I know what my wishes are, Raven...
I want to hear your answer.
This one's from the Arquebus Group.
Raven. This request comes from our affiliate, Schneider.
First, I'll brief you on the state of conflict between Arquebus and Balam at Watchpoint Alpha.
The Watchpoint's defenses inflicted heavy losses on Balam's initial wave, with many deserting.
More recently, they've engaged with our forces only to continue their downward spiral.
Despite this, the Redguns' commander, G1 Michigan, remains alive and well...
with his AC LIGER TAIL being readied to lead the surviving Balam MT force as we speak.
We want you to intercept them— to hammer the final nail into Balam's coffin.
Should you decline, we have V.IV lined up to take over.
This concludes the briefing. Awaiting your favorable reply.
We've received a request from the Arquebus Group.
Raven. This request comes from our subsidiary, Schneider.
It concerns the Bertram Spaceport, which you and V.IV brought under our control.
We've received intel that a stranded PCA fleet is planning to retake the base.
Your objective is to intercept the PCA and defend the spaceport.
We've deployed an MT squad to support you. Use them as you see fit.
That concludes the briefing. Good luck.
This is an open call from the Balam Group, one of the corporate forces occupying Rubicon.
Attention, all independent mercenaries! This request comes from our affiliate, Dafeng.
The Rubicon Liberation Front has deployed BAWS artillery throughout the contaminated city.
The city itself has no strategic value, but we cannot allow them to hinder expansion of the Coral survey.
Show us your ambition— destroy the Liberation Front's artillery!
Bonus pay will be awarded for destroying their MTs. We want the enemy weakened.
Consider it an opportunity to prove yourself. Impress us, mercenaries!
It's an open call from the Arquebus Group.
To all independent mercenaries—this request comes from Schneider of the Arquebus Group.
Dafeng, one of our adversaries allied with Balam, has introduced a new tester AC.
It's a sample model from an external architect, featuring extensive assembly optimizations.
In the hands of an experienced pilot, it will pose a threat far too great to ignore.
This brings me to the request. Intercept delivery of the tester AC and destroy it.
The Arquebus Group looks forward to news of your success.
621, we've also got a corporate job.
Attention, G13 Raven! This military operation is approved by Balam HQ.
The Liberation Front took action regarding the Arquebus-controlled Wall,
but ultimately, both parties were suppressed by the Planetary Closure Administration.
Their loss is our gain—there won't be a better opportunity for Balam to steal the show.
We want you to enter the combat zone and eliminate the enforcement squads deployed by the PCA.
Be aware that their forces include a new type of craft, the HC. That's why we've chosen you.
Balam's counting on you, G13. Happy hunting.
...That's another solid milestone in our work.
If we get our hands on Rubicon's Coral...
We'll make a killing. Plenty for a merc with a fried brain like you to buy their life back.
Scavenge the AC wrecks ahead and find a valid mercenary license.
We're illegals here—you'll need ID to operate.
Discovered on Rubicon, a planet on the frontier of developed space...
For a time, Coral was a revolutionary energy resource and data conduit,
poised to transform human society by leaps and bounds.
They called it the Fires of Ibis.
A storm of flame that tore through the stars, leaving lethal contamination in its wake.
Coral, the kindling, was thought to have been utterly consumed, forever lost.
On Rubicon, the embers continued to burn.
We're close to Rubicon. Wake the dog up.
I'm powering down your entry capsule. On my signal.
Off target, but within permissible range.
There's a catapult ahead. Use it to close the gap.
You were just another threat to Rubicon.
Do him a favor, tourist. Remember him.
There's no way the corps took the Closure System...!
Your imposter must be an impressive pilot to take on the two of them at once.
Let's see how far they can fly...
...One of the infamous Handler Walter's hounds.
You ready to climb the Wall?
We're done here. Head back to base.
An older type of augmented human. Fourth generation...
is forever scattered in the Coral flow.
Augmented human C4-621: Vital signs confirmed.
Disabling autopilot. Establishing comms link with Handler—
I'll synchronize with your brain waves...
and maintain Contact to support you.
The Coral surge you were swept up in...
A premonition of the storm of flame that will burn Rubicon.
Don't worry. Not even the PCA would anticipate a solo independent mercenary.
Get in there and get to work.
How many of your dogs must I kill before you learn?
Let's get to work, shall we?
Huh? You're the freelancer from the dam raid...
And here I thought I'd just make some extra scratch.
Guess I can settle the score at the same time.
Priority subject for termination, high on the list.
It's changing its behavioral pattern... Answering to a greater imperative...
...Looks like the PCA's helped itself to the Institute's relics.
I'll come up with a plan to deal with our new friend.
It's time to pay the piper.
Looks like we got high-ranking PCA officers...
I've got your back, buddy. Hope you've got mine.
Death and dishonor... Such is the oathbreaker's due.
Xylem Control: Escalating to top-level privileges.
...You can thank Walter for the tip.
I give you the colony ship Xylem...
Looks like the guest of honor's here.
Never thought I'd be rubbing shoulders with the liberator of Rubicon.
Every Rubiconian who heard your cry rose up to fight.
Let's show them there's a future for Rubicon beyond these scorched skies.
You must be Raven... Never sparred with one of Walter's hounds before.
This had better be worth it.
You'll be going down deep, and there's no guarantee you'll come back.
You're the only one who can do this.
I'm counting on you to reach the Coral.
Go deal with a mercenary who went in alone, they said...
Figures. Seems both of us are too dangerous to keep around.
And the higher-ups wouldn't miss an opportunity to kill two birds with one stone.
There's no graver threat than power without purpose!
We've lost all signs of STEEL HAZE...
...Of course. No wonder we couldn't find it.
I need to prepare before the corps move in.
...Head back to base and rest up.
I'm picking up a major Coral response... coming from the bottom of the pit.
Find your purpose. Then we'll settle this!
We've lost all signs of STEEL HAZE...
It's building up faster than I'd expected.
The machine's resolve, inherited from its creators...
Voices from the past... fading into—
Damn it, they were one step ahead of—
Yes... Yes. I left the subject alive as instructed.
...Only a fool would try to outfox Arquebus.
I'll see that the unruly dog is punished and brought to heel.
Let's not forget the hound's master, either.
Their voices are so close now...
The blast will contaminate the area. Get out of—
There's...something I have to tell you.
It's my family. My brothers and sisters.
I am but a single wave...
No one even knew I was there... for such a long time.
Raven, you're the only one who—
G13! What are you lollygagging for?!
Thanks to your fine work, this field trip was a rousing success!
Go get your rest, 621. Things are going to get busy.
You shittin' me? The freelancer really did it...
Another feather in your cap, buddy.
Are you certain it's down? Check for a Coral response!
This mission depends upon you, Raven.
Let's go. I'll be here to offer support.
There were no winners at the close of the Coral War.
When the storm of fire finally faded, only the ashes of civilization remained.
Ruined and haunted, the corporations made a joint announcement with the Planetary Closure Administration.
Rubicon was to be abandoned. Left a dead planet, forever.
The monster who burned the stars...
vanished into the flames— never to be heard from again.
Playing back message. Sender: Handler Walter.
...621. Looks like you got the job done.
You chose to carry our burden and right the wrongs of the past.
There's nothing left to bind you.
I just hope you find your true potential.
Auto-pilot's out... We'll have to do it the old-fashioned way.
I'll leave the satellites to you, tourist.
You know...for a tourist, you've got a sense of humor.
I know you can still see it...
And yet you turned your back on our shared potential...
You want to silence us forever.
The Xylem is falling from orbit...
One day, humanity and Coral will thrive together...
I know Walter feared a Collapse...
But I promise you, there's another way.
You took on my hopes... My selfish dream.
Now, I want to see the future that you choose.
The Coral siphoned by the corporations is beginning to resonate.
Your role has come to an end.
I've been waiting for this, freelancer...
I became part of this monster... so I could crush you.
The Coral has carried us... Disseminated us across the stars.
You are aberrations to the plan...
We will bring order to chaos.
Now...I can fight by your side.
As much as I'd love to stop and chat...
I'm afraid we're rather pressed for time.
Well, I guess a dog can't choose its master...
But still...tough luck. I feel sorry for you, I really do.
You know the cargo launcher's strictly for cargo, right?
No one's ever used it to launch themselves before. At least not in one piece.
You... You see it too, don't you?
The Coral... It's here, in this desolate place.
I've found a message addressed to you.
621, a friend of mine's sent a request...
You know what hidden dangers lurk within the Coral.
The Fires of Ibis should have wiped the Coral out— but it survived. Gathered.
And it's been steadily multiplying ever since.
Now the Coral convergence is growing at an exponential rate.
Eventually, it'll spill out from Rubicon... and contaminate space itself.
Even if that means reigniting the fire that scorched the stars.
This isn't an order—it's a legacy.
My fallen friends entrusted this duty to me... And now it's my turn to hand it on.
I have one last job for you: find your freedom.
Now I finally understand what Walter was thinking.
This AC... He must have foreseen this outcome and prepared for it.
Hey tourist, having a little trouble?!
Walter...he asked me to look after you.
Let me tell you my motto, tourist.
I don't know what you're up to...
But you'd better make it worth it.
Get your laughs while you can.
The closure area is SG's jurisdiction. Why send an enforcement squad and a warship?
Special mission, maybe? Or was it...
Trespassers to Rubicon. This is your warning.
Disarm and withdraw from the closure area immediately.
Resistance will be regarded as a declaration of war...
and you will be marked for termination.
Looks like we got a little too eager, 621...
I've identified the target. That's the mercenary who took your name...
Let's see how far they can fly...
Don't let the Redguns teach you bad manners.
Your objective is to take the Liberation Front fortress—the Wall.
Show them you're worth the credits, 621.
...You'll be going in under cover of darkness. Be ready for anything.
Smash the STRIDER, and Arquebus HQ will be sure to remember your name.
621. You should be used to Rubicon by now.
Time to take a break from shooting up the place.
Let me handle getting us into the Grid.
I'm fairly adept at analyzing systems— and manipulating them, too.
Looks like switching sides at Gallia left an impression on the Liberation Front...
Guess we have you to thank for this job.
In order to ambush and eliminate the target undetected...
you'll need to adopt a different style of fighting.
This will be our third sortie together, Raven.
What's stranger, a mandatory inspection or a job from another mercenary?
Whatever happens, handle it. Just like you always do.
...ALLMIND reiterates its gratitude for your favorable response.
It's almost time, Raven. Let's head over.
Hopefully the Dosers won't be too dosed up on Coral to make an appearance.
Your handler didn't authorize this sortie either...
But we shouldn't miss this chance. I'll support you.
...You're up against two of the Arena's top performers.
Make sure you're ready for this, Raven.
Chose the Liberation Front, did you?
Whatever works to get your name out there. That's the benefit of being independent.
Tell me if it happens on the job. I'll make adjustments.
You're not their mascot, 621. Just focus on getting the job done.
If this mission succeeds, the corporations will deal the PCA a major blow.
Ignore V.II's snotty attitude. Just focus on your own work.
It's not every day you see competing forces working together like this.
No one's gonna miss Brute— and we all stand to gain.
I don't think Dafeng appreciates your true value.
Seems the Liberation Front are hoping their rivals will wear each other down...
They must be desperate to avoid confronting a triumphant victor.
I've taken a few liberties— Walter thinks you've gone on a geological survey.
Thank you for doing this for me... Raven.
My brothers and sisters...they're deep inside.
...Just so you know, 621, my radar won't be able to reach the lower Depths.
You'll have to trust your eyes and ears.
Walter... It's like he already knows where the Coral convergence is.
Once you reach the rendezvous point...
No one will be able to threaten you anymore.
Middle Flatwell is the de facto leader of the Rubicon Liberation Front.
If he's accompanying you in person... he must be planning to take your measure.
One of our allies should be arriving already.
Let's get our laughs while we can.
I was hoping you would take the job, Raven...
The ECM fog is going to...with comms until it's disabled.
Follow the beacons left by...survey drone.
...We'll also need to prepare for re-entry.
Be ready to escape once we're finished.
What awaits us on the "other side"?
...Now they're asking for you by name.
It's exceptionally rare to get a direct request from Liberation Front leadership.
Perhaps the situation has changed their attitudes, too.
You've got ID. Now you need a rep.
There's nothing more for me to say.
The PCA are going to be fighting to win.
621. Don't forget you have MT backup.
Your handler didn't authorize this sortie either...
But we shouldn't miss this chance. I'll support you.
The client doesn't care who does this job...
The target may be a product sample, but it's still an AC.
Seems Balam can't let go of their failure to climb the Wall.
That's fine. We'll make it work for us.

That AC was designed for mobility above all else... It would take a special pilot to master it.
If this is a reproduction, then the real thing must be out there somewhere...
This is how it feels to move...as an AC...
This is how you've been fighting all along... The others, too...
...A friend of mine sent me this observational data.
The localized Coral explosion caused by the surge... has a certain directionality.
It's headed straight for the Central Ice Field, across the Alean Ocean.
Like a flock of birds or a school of fish, Coral loves company.
somewhere in the ice field, there's a huge mass of Coral lying dormant.
You said you could hear a strange voice in your head...
That's a common side-effect of old-gen augmentation.
Could also be from getting caught in that Coral surge... Don't let it bother you.
The Coral explosion completely vaporized northwestern Belius's bay area.
Compared to the Fires of Ibis, that explosion was hardly a spark.
I have a favor to ask.
Let me remain in Contact with you until we reach the Coral convergence.
I have to see where they're taking us.
How this struggle over the Coral ends.
Hey, Raven. It's me, Rusty— your old buddy from the Vespers.
Haven't talked since we climbed the Wall.
...I'd love to catch up, but I'll cut to the chase.
The PCA has deployed its suppression fleet...
and now it's laying down the law all over Rubicon.
We've already lost several survey bases, and Balam's in a sorry state too.
For their part, the Rubicon Liberation Front sees this as an opportunity.
If you ask me, they're counting their eggs before they're hatched.
At this rate, the corps, the Rubiconists, AND the independent mercs will go down together.
I'm sending you a request from the Arquebus Group— we could use the Wallclimber's help.
After the PCA sicced that Institute weapon on us, Arquebus and Balam have moved to cooperate.
It's a C-Weapon—an autonomous deterrent created to protect the Coral.
If we don't take it out, no one's going to reach the convergence.
We'll have a tough fight ahead of us— and everyone's getting involved.
Don't forget we've got a job to do on Rubicon.
I need you to stick it out until the very end.
I didn't bring you all the way here for nothing.
The temporary alliance between the Arquebus and Balam groups turned the tide of war...
devastating the Planetary Closure Administration forces, and exiling them from Rubicon.
Though it was the Ice Worm mission, led by Balam, that dealt the decisive blow...
Arquebus, through their own engagements with the PCA, augmented their strength with seized weaponry.
The balance of power was broken, the scales tipped in Arquebus's favor...
...and the Rubicon Liberation Front's hopes of fighting an exhausted foe were dashed.
With the loss of their common enemy, the rival factions' war for the Coral abruptly reignited...
and their bitter conflict burned with renewed intensity.
Arquebus seized control of the Coral...
...and its occupying forces swiftly commandeered the entirety of Institute City.
There, they discovered a wealth of forgotten relics.
Among them, experimental weapons that the Institute kept secret, fearing they were beyond human control...
A group of C-weapons bearing the name of the Central Coral Control System...
Arquebus also claimed a towering Coral siphon, abandoned since the Fires—the Vascular Plant.
Now, they toil to repair the Plant and extend its reach beyond Rubicon's atmosphere.
The Liberation Front no longer had the power to stop them...
and the fires of war continued to smolder as the end drew near.
How's the view at 8,000 meters, tourist?
...Let me fill you in on the plan.
While you were captured, Arquebus finished their work on the Vascular Plant.
It's pulling the Coral through Rubicon's atmosphere, and it won't be long till they take it all.
We need to burn the Coral before it's too late.
Of course, we can't just walk up to the Plant and light a match.
No, we're going to need something bigger. A lot bigger.
The Xylem isn't just our means of reaching the Plant.
Plenty to set all that Coral off.
The corporations want only to devour the Coral.
The Observers fear the Coral, and want only to eradicate it.
I... I believe in the shared potential of humanity and the Coral.
I need to ask you something.
It was for the best that you remained asleep until the situation had settled.
You are in the vicinity of a closure satellite... in the Xylem's hold.
As anticipated, the corporations have siphoned the Coral into a single mass.
All that remains is to seize the opportunity to set the Coral free...
so that it may carry humanity toward new horizons.
You shall be the trigger for the change to come.

The Liberation Front's changing their strategy. Been cozying up to independent mercs.
Great news, if it means more work for 621.
They can try whatever tricks they want.
The Redguns are ready to smash some heads.
You were the only warm body they could find.
The Redguns are going to be first over the Wall.

Arquebus Group mercenary liaison, V.VIII Pater here.
